column1: Aquí hay una lista de recursos alimenticios para cualquier persona en Massachusetts que busque asistencia durante la pandemia #COVID19. Encuentre ayuda aquí: https://t.co/ufQBxAsdl2 y FoodSource Hotline ahora al 1-800-645-8333.  https://t.co/TrNjWXjot3 https://t.co/UjOPTGqPgf

No one should go hungry today or any day. Here is a list of food resources form @projectbread for anyone in Massachusetts seeking assistance during the #COVID19 pandemic. Call the FoodSource Hotline at 1-800-645-8333 or find help here: https://t.co/TGLT9PW7Gy https://t.co/EYiIk0rNfq

Our work honoring our veterans every day is far from over.  For the brave men and women that we tragically lost at our Soldiers Homes during the coronavirus pandemic so that there is accountability and protections moving forward. https://t.co/CMAGWSvR3k

8000000 more Americans are in poverty since the beginning of the COVID pandemic. U.S. billionaires’ wealth grew by hundreds of billions.   We need to make billionaires pay. Let’s start by taxing their pandemic profits at 60% and giving everyone health care for a year.

As we confront a third wave of infections and deaths make no mistake about who is to blame here. Donald Trump just said that his “pride” is what's in the way of delivering relief as millions of Americans suffer during the COVID-19 pandemic. Nothing less than criminal negligence. https://t.co/3KWGDiZ3kV

12 million Americans may have lost employer-sponsored health insurance during the COVID pandemic. So what do Senate Republicans do? Ignore their desperate cries for help and jam through a nominee who would vote to rip away coverage for millions more. #WhatsAtStake #SCOTUShearings

We see Trump's deadly mishandling of the COVID-19 pandemic. Does anyone think he should have sole authority to launch a U.S. nuclear weapon? My bill w @RepTedLieu  says that no President should be able to launch one without Congressional approval. https://t.co/i0M2E93Jwd

As the US approaches 200000 COVID deaths & with nearly 11000 people exposed to the virus on flights we STILL don’t have a national plan for aviation health & safety. Congress must pass my & @SenBlumenthal’s legislation & create a task force for protecting the flying public.

We need a robust comprehensive response right now that matches the scale of the economic crisis caused by COVID. And we have an opportunity to deliver some real justice to working Americans and families. https://t.co/CwBLIarhhP

At 12pm ET I’ll be on the Senate floor to call for the urgent support families and workers need in the next COVID-19 package. Recurring cash payments rental assistance an eviction moratorium billions in E-Rate funding. And more. Watch live: https://t.co/Ety31p0aYq

The Senate Republican COVID package is insulting to the Americans who have been waiting for months for relief. The extent of the misery is unimaginable & McConnell responds by designing a bill so intentionally weak & insufficient that it’s destined to fail.  It’s a game to them.

COVID has led to resources being directed away from efforts to control EEE a rare and deadly mosquito-borne illness. @SenWarren and I are urging the CDC to find ways to help state and local governments prevent EEE during the pandemic.  https://t.co/n4ELNwBGP8

Make inmate calling free during the pandemic.  At a time when many of us are feeling the pain of being separated from our loved ones I’m proud to fight alongside @SenAmyKlobuchar to include this in the next COVID relief package. https://t.co/WVUr2NWuLM

More than 160000 Americans are dead. Millions more have lost their jobs.  The American people pay with their lives every day for the criminal negligence of the Trump administration to combat COVID. It is time the country’s wealthiest do the same with their profits.

Immigrants are being left out of COVID stimulus payments. In Massachusetts 75% of households surveyed that have an undocumented member have not received any kind of federal stimulus funds. 78% report not having enough to eat.   We need safety net funding for ALL immigrants. https://t.co/eYzjc8jarh
We must fully fund the U.S. Postal Service and its dedicated workers in the next COVID relief package.

This report is a timely reminder about why Congress must take immediate action to bridge the #HomeworkGap in our next COVID relief package and include my bill to allocate at least $4 billion through the E-Rate program. https://t.co/Q9FxIGlMpL

The threat of extreme heat is heightened by COVID which most severely harms the same communities most vulnerable to extreme heat. My bill provides the funds coordination and help that communities need to prepare for and respond to extreme heat events. https://t.co/p9I6k6PwNn

Governments are cracking down on dissent restricting media freedom and increasing surveillance in the name of COVID. The U.S. must be a leading voice to support human rights around the world at this difficult time.

COVID has blown wide-open one of the nation’s worst kept secrets: the inequity with which students are not able to access the internet at home. Congress should invest at least $4 billion in E-Rate to close the #HomeworkGap before the fall. https://t.co/01MfGXX1Mo

Investments in internet access disproportionately bypass people of color. We have to fix this inequity and we can help close the #HomeworkGap by including at least $4 billion for the E-Rate program in the next COVID relief package. https://t.co/NL7sZ9XCvk

We need a MASSIVE investment in universal connectivity combined with a new National Broadband Plan and at least $4 billion for closing the homework gap to provide relief and ensure a just recovery from COVID-19. In 2020 broadband is a jobs education and civil rights issue. https://t.co/DJUN9mo3YF

Residents of Chelsea are facing the twin crises of COVID-19 and air pollution exacerbated by years of environmental racism. @RepPressley and I are calling on the EPA to install air monitors - a first step towards cleaner air for Chelsea. https://t.co/3jEvDH8ZBo

First responders on the front lines of the COVID-19 pandemic shouldn’t need to worry about losing the communications tools they rely on every day. I’m pleased that my colleagues in the House just advanced our legislation to preserve access T-Band spectrum. @EnergyCommerce

ICE’s new guidance would force many international students to make an impossible decision: expose yourself to COVID-19 or risk deportation. This has nothing to do with public health. @SenWarren @RepPressley and I are demanding the Trump admin immediately withdraw this guidance. https://t.co/cNRtHwLxaL

If Sec. Pompeo is so worried about transparency during the COVID-19 crisis why has it been 455 days since he testified before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee? Congress and the American people deserve answers. https://t.co/KA25P5Qiq6

Pure idiocy. Withdrawing from the WHO plays right into Russia and China’s hands by isolating the US from the rest of the world. Trump is enabling the spread of #COVID19 and other diseases and cutting us off from disease tracking and coordinating efforts. https://t.co/p9Ft9oEXaL

We are simply not doing enough to protect our seniors or workers in assisted living homes from COVID-19. The federal government must ensure these facilities are actively monitored for potential outbreaks and are getting the test supplies and PPE they need. https://t.co/zWhh8nUbce

Rushing to reopen immigration courts as new daily COVID-19 cases around the country are at an all-time high would be the height of recklessness.   That’s why I introduced legislation to halt all deportations and suspend in-person immigration court proceedings during this crisis. https://t.co/Kq53nWB7mv

President Trump’s efforts to demonize deport and expel immigrants accelerates the spread of COVID-19.  Today I introduced the Immigration Enforcement Moratorium Act to halt the admin’s harmful immigration enforcement activities including deportations during the pandemic.

Providing recurring monthly payments is the most direct and efficient mechanism for delivering economic relief to working families and those most vulnerable in the COVID-19 crisis.  @SenSanders @SenKamalaHarris and I are calling for $2k monthly payments. https://t.co/2jegYQOe5r

Turkey’s treatment of this State Dept. employee is unacceptable and he should be released immediately. Erdogan should end political prosecutions and ensure that COVID-19 prisoner releases include those arbitrarily detained including journalists and human rights defenders. https://t.co/WT8kooDPe1

Jair Bolsonaro is a racist homophobe who suppresses human rights threatens military intervention is destroying the Amazon rainforest and denies the second highest worldwide number of COVID-19 cases. https://t.co/swigvArF1s

Federal health and safety rules are urgently needed to curb the further spread of COVID-19 while protecting travelers and frontline workers in the sky. @SenBlumenthal and I are demanding stronger leadership from the federal government. https://t.co/WR7v7ngl4Y

The BRAIN TRAIN Act will create new jobs combat climate change and mitigate traffic congestion. When the coronavirus pandemic is over and whether you are traveling to Boston Springfield Hartford or NYC the BRAIN TRAIN will help you get there. https://t.co/P5hs320Hl1

Our nation needs a force of health care workers who can step in to support #COVID19 response efforts. Public health experts are sounding the alarm: the only way to achieve a safe reopening is to hire an army of public health workers. https://t.co/5L1Iz8eUhm

She triages calls sets up patients for COVID testing counsels them on prevention and tests and treats moderately symptomatic patients in the outpatient COVID clinic. These interventions have reduced ER visits and hospitalizations which would have overwhelmed our hospitals.

Dr. Remya Ravindran is an internist serving in Brockton a #COVID19 hotspot. Dr. Ravindran like many other internists has been handling a large volume of patients via telehealth.   Thank you Dr. Ravindran. #ImmigrantHealthHeroes https://t.co/6o5r5jLbBw

100000+ deaths is a tragedy.  And preventable.  We need testing tracing PPE and direct cash assistance NOW to avoid more preventable suffering.  The COVID-19 death toll should be the number President Trump is worried about. Not his approval rating or his golf score.

I’m proud to partner with @RepCohen + @RepUnderwood on the Cash Refunds for Coronavirus Cancellations Act. Together we are fighting to make airlines give consumers their money back during this pandemic. https://t.co/E49Mca7jvA

A simultaneous peak of coronavirus and the seasonal flu later this year would be catastrophic if we're not prepared. @SenWarren and I are urging the White House to act now to ensure our system won’t be overwhelmed if we have to face this grim scenario. https://t.co/kPZ86Oqgnw

Airline consumer complaints quadrupled in March and the top category: REFUNDS. Travelers are rightfully demanding their money back. That’s why I’ve introduced legislation to require cash refunds for ALL cancelled tickets during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/c8jyq61RdF

Sylvia Chiang is the director of the Revere CARES Coalition. Revere is a #COVID19 hotspot and Sylvia a native of Honduras is helping to bring cultural proficiency to MGH Revere’s outreach efforts to the city’s Latinx population.   Thank you Sylvia. #ImmigrantHealthHeroes https://t.co/AXCA5YIjov

Through both his actions and inactions EPA Administrator Andrew Wheeler has made people more vulnerable to #COVID19 especially in underserved communities with historic injustices of pollution and bad air.  Shame on him. He owes them and all Americans an apology. https://t.co/NRHi2n07J4

We're in the middle of a health crisis attacking peoples’ lungs but EPA Admin Wheeler is waging a full out assault on air quality standards.  His job is to protect public health and he's taking actions that will make the #COVID19 crisis worse.  He should be ashamed of himself.

New @EPWDems report demonstrates the dangers of EPA’s #PollutionPandemic amid the ongoing COVID-19 crisis – rollbacks that will result in more air pollution and worse public health outcomes. https://t.co/yz2PknYowm

It is unacceptable that ICE is including on deportation flight manifests individuals known to have tested positive for coronavirus. I'm calling on the Trump administration to halt all deportations to Haiti during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/QcVA7bxus0

While people deal with the reality of #COVID19 in America Homeland Security Republicans are concerned with a fake conspiracy in Ukraine.  If Republicans cared about everyone as much as they care about Hunter Biden maybe 90000+ Americans wouldn’t be dead. https://t.co/iaTUDQXXrp

The #COVID19 pandemic has shown us how important it is to coordinate science research and stay at the forefront of health technology. This bill will enable us to better coordinate bioengineering research and ensure we remain a global leader.  https://t.co/OGBpWTKKSo

As we endure the many global challenges #COVID19 has caused we must lead the fight protect our citizens and offer assistance to those suffering around the world. I've outlined international priorities that should be included in future relief packages. https://t.co/gVQk7yhd2B

Sylvestre Antonio Maria Valdez a native of the Dominican Republic is the manager of Medical Interpreters and the food pantry at the MGH Chelsea HealthCare Center working tirelessly for the Chelsea community hard hit by #COVID19.  Thank you Sylvestre. #ImmigrantHealthHeroes https://t.co/csUJNbhBnz

Yahaira Guzman runs the Food for Families food pantry at MGH Chelsea HealthCare Center. A native of the Dominican Republic Yahaira is helping to address the overwhelming need for food in Chelsea during #COVID19.  Thank you Yahaira. #ImmigrantHealthHeroes https://t.co/8F7vy0s4t7

First responders across the country are at risk of losing a critical communications tool. Congress must do right by the heroes on the front lines of the #COVID19 pandemic and preserve their access to T-Band in the next recovery legislation. https://t.co/CvH82rwc2w

The only thing someone should have to worry about when they get sick is getting better not medical bankruptcy.    We need to pass @SenSanders’s Health Care Emergency Guarantee Act and eliminate all out-of pocket health costs during #COVID19 because health care is a human right.

Great news that @usedgov will enable colleges to continue distance learning through the end of the year as @SenSherrodBrown and I fought for. But we’re not done fighting for the Dept. to conduct oversight so we can make sure schools are supporting students during #COVID19.
Network of Care Massachusetts’ #COVID19 Behavioral Health Information Hub has a wealth of resources for all Massachusetts residents: https://t.co/eYj06o4D3I  #MentalHealthMonth

The next #COVID19 package needs to include support for the clean energy sector which has been devastated by the pandemic. Our response can’t just be a reaction it has to be an investment in the technologies & workers who will power this country’s future. https://t.co/r6o1gtJoZo

Attention service members veterans and their families. @HomeBaseProgram continues to be a resource to you during #COVID19. Here is some helpful information.  #MentalHealthMonth  https://t.co/b9ZO5iSmu0

Americans need cash in their pockets to pay for food housing and prescriptions not temporary credits toward future travel.   I'm introducing legislation to require major airlines to offer full cash refunds for all cancelled tickets during #COVID19. https://t.co/1y5TpfSvrp

Dr. Sunny Chavan is a lead physician at a community health center in Brockton MA treating a primarily underserved population. He has been a frontline provider treating #COVID19 patients & contributing to the incident command team.  Thank you Dr. Chavan. #ImmigrantHealthHeroes. https://t.co/yWzV1Jo1Ud

#COVID19 has shined a light on the racism and inequalities in our economy that existed before this virus spread. We are seeing that disparity in relief getting to our small businesses. Proud to join with @SenDuckworth to correct some of these problems. https://t.co/0hxJ9Lu2nL

Congress should take immediate action to close the #HomeworkGap and increase funding for E-Rate by $4B. All students in America should have the connectivity they need. I will fight to make sure this is included in any future #COVID19 relief package. https://t.co/wgkwEJS3iE

No one should lose the roof over their head during #COVID19. I’m calling for a national eviction moratorium and joining @SenSherrodBrown in fighting for $100 billion in rent relief in the next stimulus package.

We need an ambitious FDR New Deal-style response to #COVID19.  We need to rebuild and transform our society and economy to prioritize the working class.  And we need to get Americans money NOW. That's why @SenSanders @SenKamalaHarris and I are calling for $2k monthly payments. https://t.co/KiOGFbKA8v

Dulce Veiga a native of Cape Verde works in Environmental Services cleaning and sanitizing patient rooms during #COVID19 @NewtonWellesley. She’s proud to help support patients and medical staff safely during this unprecedented time.  Thank you Dulce. #ImmigrantHealthHeroes https://t.co/HCTJTYrrzA

Walmart employees like so many workers risk their health every day for a paycheck. Walmart needs to treat them with the respect they deserve but they are failing in Massachusetts. We demand to know what Walmart is doing to keep workers safe and stop the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/c9A6pW5l1h

I'm proud that the COVID-19 International Response and Recovery Act includes several provisions from my legislation that would deter authoritarian opportunism protect American citizens abroad while fighting infections overseas and promote humanitarian access to North Korea. https://t.co/L3B161Hg9e

A single check is not sufficient for households that are struggling during #COVID19. Americans need more than just one payment  @SenKamalaHarris @SenSanders and I are calling for a monthly $2000 check for every individual with an income below $120000. https://t.co/KfA3GCkwaw

Governments are using the #COVID19 crisis as an excuse to persecute LGBTQI individuals. The U.S. must stand up for human rights.   @RepDinaTitus and I along with 45 colleagues outlined steps for the @StateDept and @USAID to protect their rights. https://t.co/4h3BzXB1ti

Around the world it’s clear that some leaders see #COVID19 as an opportunity to consolidate power and silence dissent. This legislation will make sure that the U.S. acts as a leading voice to support human rights around the world at this difficult time. https://t.co/5LCoxRZLiL

Peace Corps volunteers who were evacuated due to #COVID19 are among the best ambassadors our country has to offer.    I applaud the Peace Corps for offering readmission of evacuated volunteers to their previous country posts as @ChrisVanHollen and I called for in the UNITE Act.

#COVID19 has shown us that our work is far from done to ensure universal connectivity.   We need to update the National Broadband Plan so we can continue to invest in our nation’s future by bringing the power and promise of broadband to us all. https://t.co/cG0mBSrI2w

Glad that Frontier listened to me and @RepCohen and is dropping it’s outrageous middle seat fee. No one should have to pay extra for health during the #COVID19 crisis. I’ll keep fighting to eliminate all unfair airline fees. https://t.co/umJLbJhZj8

President Trump and Sec Pompeo are eager to blame China about spread of #COVID19 but have been unwilling to provide basic information about their own response. If Pompeo has evidence for his claim that the coronavirus originated in a Chinese lab he should present it immediately.

10 years. 500000 deaths. 11 million displaced. #COVID19 may have made some people forget about the humanitarian crisis in Syria but it could make the crisis even worse. @JohnBoozman and I are asking the Trump admin to follow our outline and bring relief to the Syrian people. https://t.co/Fui9ahj7CM

Dr. Saleena Arif is a primary care physician at a community health center in MA. She is involved in testing and management of #COVID19 patients while also ensuring timely healthcare for patients with other acute or chronic illnesses.  Thank you Dr. Arif. #ImmigrantHealthHeroes https://t.co/rI3qXhiZk8
Concerned about your child’s mental health during #COVID19? The Children’s Mental Health Campaign has lots of great resources. #MentalHealthMonth   @kidsMHmass  https://t.co/TtiFYqzk4M

Our essential workers deserve protections.   Paid sick time. PPE. Universal health care. Layoff protections.  We need to provide these protections during the #COVID19 emergency and we need to provide it every single day for every single worker.  #ProtectAllWorkers https://t.co/U4nD4YDL7B

Pleased that this incorporates key aspects of the UNITE Act which I announced w/ @ChrisVanHollen through its commitment to the flagship AmeriCorps programs to aid vulnerable communities and its commitment to increase service opportunities for those left unemployed by #COVID19. https://t.co/YEIbjpplsL

May is Mental Health Awareness Month. Throughout the month I will be sharing resources for those seeking help. If you or someone you know is having a difficult time during #COVID19 please don’t hesitate to seek assistance. #MentalHealthMonth https://t.co/T59qspXsPV

We need widespread testing and contact tracing to stop #COVID19.  Millions are out of work and looking to serve.  @ChrisVanHollen and I have offered part of the solution: pass our UNITE Act and recruit hundreds of thousands of people to test trace and assist the vulnerable. https://t.co/Vh8Io7pWsZ

I’ve called out the Chinese government’s expulsions of journalists and I ensured that the Senate resolution honoring Chinese doctors and nurses fighting #COVID19 also recognized independent journalists censored for their reporting.

Assisted living facilities have no reporting requirement for their #COVID19 responses & are at risk of becoming hot spots.  We need to know what is being done to protect these high-risk populations. @SenWarren & I demand they release the data we need to keep our loved ones safe. https://t.co/BhemY4QNNr

I’m glad that airlines are listening to my call and increasingly recognize that *everyone* traveling needs to wear a mask during #COVID19. Every airline must do the same. If they don’t Congress must force airlines to require masks for everyone on flights. https://t.co/izdNjKhodg

Clearview has failed to demonstrate that it can be trusted to protect our privacy. I’m concerned that if Clearview becomes involved in our response to #COVID19 their invasive tech will become normalized and that could spell the end of our ability to move anonymously in public.

We can't let the need for COVID contact tracing be used as cover by companies like Clearview to build shadowy surveillance networks. I’m demanding Clearview tell us what government entities it has sold its facial recognition tools to during the pandemic. https://t.co/wMQuvipgfn

Trump’s fossil fuel cronies lobbied and are going to take money that was meant to help businesses survive the #COVID19 pandemic in order to bail themselves out of $200 billion in existing debt. It’s unacceptable unjust and we cannot let this stand. https://t.co/DLWNMAn2XZ

We know #COVID19 is disproportionately hurting communities of color but we still don’t have the data we need to enable a truly just response and we’re not doing enough to protect these communities in the meantime.

We cannot let students without internet access be left behind during #COVID19.  When the Senate returns @ChrisVanHollen @SenatorBennet @SenatorHassan & I will intro legislation to provide $4B in E-Rate funds to close the #HomeworkGap & ensure ALL students can keep learning.

Every person who flies during #COVID19 should be *required* to wear a face mask during the flight.  We cannot rely on individual airlines’ policies. @SenBlumenthal and I are demanding the Trump admin issue a nationwide rule to protect the crew passengers and the public.

I’m also pushing for my and @ChrisVanHollen’s UNITE Act to be included in next #COVID19 package to allow evacuated Peace Corps volunteers to either apply their skills here at home at AmeriCorps and FEMA OR to be guaranteed readmission into the Peace Corps when programs resume.

Important news for Peace Corps and other volunteers recalled due to #COVID19: you are now eligible for unemployment insurance. Our volunteers signed up to serve their country and they deserve their country’s full support during these difficult times. https://t.co/NPdeGiaz0N

It is crucial that these funds get out to Massachusetts providers impacted by #COVID19. I'm encouraged that the Trump admin has committed to provide more funds to hot spots but we will continue to press HHS to meet the needs of Massachusetts providers. https://t.co/FcK0wysvXU

Rohingya refugees who fled atrocities in Burma are already vulnerable. #COVID19 makes the situation even more dire. Denying them access to info during COVID could mean denying them life-saving services/guidance. Bangladesh should restore telecommunications access in the camps.

Now more than ever we must ensure that sick immigrants who need treatment are able to remain in the US. @SenWarren @RepPressley @SenBooker & I demand the Trump admin provide answers about whether it is granting deferred action requests during #COVID19. https://t.co/tf6xfzbk3g

Millions rely on TV/radio broadcasters and local newspapers for information and entertainment. It is especially important to protect their services during an emergency like #COVID19. I’m joining @Sen_JoeManchin in a bipartisan effort to deliver relief for local media.

Massachusetts is a serious #COVID19 hot spot. But while some states like MN and WV received $300k per COVID case Mass. only received $44k per case. @SenWarren and I urge HHS to ensure that in the next round of relief distribution hot spots like Mass. get the resources we need. https://t.co/I6kVZNbU4Z

We cannot sit on the sidelines of this fight because there are no sidelines. As the #COVID19 pandemic has made us painfully aware global problems affect each and every one of us. Climate change will be no different and we need each and every one of us to defeat it.

We need a massive contact tracing effort to stop the spread of #COVID19. But that doesn’t mean Americans should be forced to sacrifice their privacy.   I have a plan to protect your civil liberties as we undertake unprecedented contact tracing initiatives. https://t.co/9XF9D7WaQ7

To defeat #COVID19 we need expansive testing and contact tracing and hundreds of thousands of Americans committed to national service.  Pleased @ChrisCoons's legislation includes my and @ChrisVanHollen's UNITE Act to deploy an army of volunteers through programs like AmeriCorps. https://t.co/f4JH0NzdRY

It's not too late to register to join me and @EnviroLeagueMA for our #EarthDay webinar. Tune in at 12pm EDT for a discussion about how we can and must make the #COVID19 economic recovery a green one.  https://t.co/9pAfZG0BJ9

The unprecedented tragedy of #COVID19 is also an unprecedented opportunity to reorganize our economy and prioritize the health of our people and planet over profit.  On #EarthDay join me and @EnviroLeagueMA to discuss how we make the economic recovery a green one. More info here: https://t.co/R6EmZtpJTe

I plan to partner with @RepGraceMeng and introduce companion legislation in the Senate that directs billions more toward the crucial E-Rate program. We need to ensure this program is funded to close the #HomeworkGap and keep students connected during #COVID19.

If you had invested even a fraction in a pandemic response army as you wasted on your deportation army we wouldn’t be in this crisis. Stop spreading hate and focus on stopping the spread of #COVID19. Stop wasting time on closing the border and focus on reopening the economy. https://t.co/a6QgBEZCJK

I fought hard to make sure that assistance related to #COVID19 was available to those who often fall through the cracks like gig workers and other independent contractors. Today those workers can finally apply for Pandemic Unemployment Assistance. https://t.co/lpAa802Dxg

Hong Kong authorities just arrested more than a dozen activists and former lawmakers including an 81-year-old lawyer known as the “Father of Democracy.” Beijing and HK authorities can’t use #Covid19 as a cover. Beijing should know the world is watching and we #StandWithHongKong. https://t.co/RCAiGRvuPD

With our healthcare system strained by #COVID19 patients with opioid use disorders are especially vulnerable to relapse overdose and death. @SenWarren @SenatorShaheen @SenFeinstein @SenatorHassan and I want them to be able to access to the lifesaving treatment they need. https://t.co/RGYZyT1hEx

State and municipal leaders in Massachusetts have responded to #COVID19 heroically but they are in dire need of reinforcement. We need the interim emergency package to include funds to ensure our local leaders on the front lines have the resources to protect lives.

Airlines get a bailout but their customers get a voucher? No way. It’s time for the airlines to cough up cash refunds so that families can use that money for bills rent mortgage payments and staying afloat during the #COVID19 crisis.  https://t.co/1JSWo980qM

We aren’t doing enough testing to safely reopen the country.   As unemployment soars millions of Americans are ready to serve.   Congress must pass my UNITE Act to expand and deploy an army of volunteers to assist with #COVID19 testing contact tracing and help those in need. https://t.co/aAyG7o5qgD

Mercury. Lead. Arsenic.   During a pandemic where bad air has been linked to more #COVID19 deaths the Trump admin is undercutting efforts to get chemicals out of our air and lungs.   This admin isn’t serious about saving lives only about saving its relationship with Big Coal. https://t.co/YdBYbk3wnS

More than 33000 DACA & TPS recipients are on the front lines of the #COVID19 crisis risking their safety to help the people of this country. Deporting them would be beyond cruel and hurt our response. @SenatorDurbin and I urge the President to extend their work authorizations. https://t.co/yOzNuxf17W

At a time when many of us are feeling the pain of being separated from our loved ones I’m proud to have fought with @SenAmyKlobuchar to make calling free for inmates. The incarcerated are especially vulnerable during #COVID19 & don’t deserve extra costs. https://t.co/gbhX0RFegh

I’m proud to have helped secure over $171 million in emergency relief for Massachusetts airports. This funding will keep hardworking aviation workers on the job while ensuring that our essential hubs for travel and commerce are ready to resume operations when #COVID19 subsides.

The fuel industry should receive exactly $0 from the #COVID19 relief package but Trump is listening to the pleas of lobbyists instead of workers. @RepBarragan and I are fighting to make sure CARES Act funds go to workers not to bail out big oil.  #NoBigOilBailout https://t.co/Xl0rqTViuQ

Venezuela is undergoing a devastating human rights crisis which the onset of #COVID19 could make catastrophic. Yet the Trump administration has inexcusably failed to protect the approximately 200000 Venezuelan nationals who could benefit from TPS in the U.S. #VenezuelaTPSNow

Passing stimulus relief doesn’t help anyone if we can’t actually get cash to these struggling small businesses. Any #COVID19 package must include the resources the SBA needs to deliver small businesses $10000 emergency grants within the promised 72 hours. https://t.co/a79UG68IzS

It’s hard to tell which one Donald Trump cares about less: the world health or organization. But one thing is clear Trump is blaming WHO because he mismanaged our #COVID19 response.    The millions of people whose lives are at stake cannot afford these political games. https://t.co/68UlwXjq9s

Although I’m glad that the Treasury is finally cutting checks for airline employees I’m disappointed the terms will require repayment for some of the payroll grants. The Trump admin is unnecessarily endangering jobs. I’ll fight to ensure future COVID relief puts workers first. https://t.co/yieoZfEiVO

The #COVID19 pandemic is exposing existing racial and economic health disparities caused by centuries of systemic racism and we cannot emerge from this crisis without addressing them. I’m joining @SenWarren on legislation to collect the demographic data we need to justly respond. https://t.co/k14nXU63D6

Countries must not use #COVID19 as a cover to persecute LGBTI people. I denounce these attempts by the Ugandan government to target the LGBTI community and call on the Ugandan government to immediately release people who have been wrongfully imprisoned. https://t.co/hV046iTPo9
